methods.code: pub fn reunite(self, other: OwnedReadHalf) -> Result<UnixStream, ReuniteError>
methods.text: Attempts to put the two halves of a UnixStream back together and recover the original socket. Succeeds only if the two halves originated from the same call to into_split.
Destroys the write half, but donâ€™t close the write half of the stream until the read half is dropped. If the read half has already been dropped, this closes the stream.

methods.code: pub async fn ready(&self, interest: Interest) -> Result<Ready>
methods.text: Waits for any of the requested ready states.
Waits for the socket to become writable.
Tries to write a buffer to the stream, returning how many bytes were written.
Tries to write several buffers to the stream, returning how many bytes were written.
Returns the socket address of the remote half of this connection.
Returns the socket address of the local half of this connection.

methods.code: fn poll_write( self: Pin<&mut Self>, cx: &mut Context<'_>, buf: &[u8]) -> Poll<Result<usize>>
methods.text: Attempt to write bytes from buf into the object.

methods.code: fn poll_write_vectored( self: Pin<&mut Self>, cx: &mut Context<'_>, bufs: &[IoSlice<'_>]) -> Poll<Result<usize>>
methods.text: Like poll_write, except that it writes from a slice of buffers.
Determines if this writer has an efficient poll_write_vectored implementation.

methods.code: fn poll_flush(self: Pin<&mut Self>, _: &mut Context<'_>) -> Poll<Result<()>>
methods.text: Attempts to flush the object, ensuring that any buffered data reach their destination.

methods.code: fn poll_shutdown(self: Pin<&mut Self>, _: &mut Context<'_>) -> Poll<Result<()>>
methods.text: Initiates or attempts to shut down this writer, returning success when the I/O connection has completely shut down.
Formats the value using the given formatter.
Executes the destructor for this type.
